We must continue the work to address years of inequality that have left our Black brothers and sisters in such poor economic standing. To learn more about the economic conditions of Black Americans nationally and statewide, access the report here: https://t.co/UHDhaiQaJl

Black Americans have historically faced higher poverty rates, including child poverty rates, than White Americans. In 2019, the Black poverty rate in Texas was 18.4% compared to the White poverty rate of 7.9%.

However, socioeconomic barriers preventing Black Americans from accessing the same professional, financial, and childcare opportunities that are available to other racial and ethnic groups still persist.

Over the last 50 years, the number of Black students with an education has significantly increased. Since 1972, the drop out rate for Black high school students has ebbed to a historic low of 6%. And since 1990, the rate of Black adults with college degrees has more than doubled. https://t.co/fMB3uMdvkf
